title: 111_hr6271
content:
The Act is titled the "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines terms such as District, Electric Distribution System, and Fixtures related to the power distribution system in the South Utah Valley Electric Service District. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines terms related to the power distribution system, including irrigation or power facilities lands and distribution fixture lands within the Strawberry Valley Project. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines terms related to the power distribution system, including shared power poles rated at 46.0-kilovolts owned by the United States and supported fixtures. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The "South Utah Valley Electric Conveyance Act" defines terms related to the power distribution system, including shared power poles rated at 46.0-kilovolts owned by the United States and supported fixtures. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF ELECTRIC DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM. The Strawberry Water Users Association conveyed its interest in the Electric Distribution System to the District by a contract dated April 7, 1986. The Secretary shall convey and assign to the District all of the United States right, title, and interest in the fixtures and distribution fixture land. The District will have a license for perpetuity to use shared power poles for Electric Distribution Fixtures. The District will have licenses for perpetuity to use shared power poles for Electric Distribution Fixtures across project lands and corridors abutting public streets and roads. Before conveying lands, interest in lands, and fixtures, the Secretary must comply with environmental laws such as the National Environmental Policy Act and the Endangered Species Act. This Act does not change any existing obligations under environmental laws. The Secretary must comply with environmental laws such as the National Environmental Policy Act and the Endangered Species Act before conveying lands, interests, or fixtures. This Act does not alter existing obligations under these laws. SEC. 4. EFFECT OF CONVEYANCE.

Upon conveyance under section 3(a)(1):
- The land and facilities will no longer be part of a Federal reclamation project.
- The District will not receive future Bureau or Reclamation benefits, except those available to other non-Bureau facilities.
- The United States will not be liable for damages, except for negligence before the conveyance date.

SEC. 5. REPORT. If conveyance under section 3 is not completed within 24 months, the Secretary must report to Congress on the status, obstacles, and anticipated completion date.
